1551.content:
Here are our two main characters

Name: Jack Castle
Age: 45
Powers: increased resilience, size and strength
Appearance: Doc Castle's DNA has been fused with that of an African Elephant. As a result he stands at 7' 9" tall, his body is very bulky and stout. His head looks like that of an elephant, with tusks, ears and a trunk he can control easily. He has grey, leathery skin that is extremely thick and resistant to bullets and blunt trauma
Back Story: Doc Castle is one of the older surviving experiments. He was forced to survive in this harsh world from a young age, which made him develop a serious and stern demeanor, along with a very strong sense of honor. Those traits coupled with his high natural strength pushed him to become a lawman in the city of Junktown, one of the few civilized settlements in this ruined world. He can usually be found breaking up bar brawls, punishing outlaws or repelling raiders.

Name: Marty Winger
Age: 16
Powers: has a pair of black wings on his back which grant him flight
Appearance: Marty Winger's DNA has been fused with that of a Raven. He has black, messy feathers over his entire body, thin bird like legs and a beaked head resembling that of a raven. He has a pair of wings on his back, that he normally keeps tucked in.
Back Story: Marty's parents abandoned him to fend for himself at a very young age. He became a scavenger and street urchin, and he developed a cowardly and shy personality, often flying away at the slightest sign of danger. He eventually ended up in Junktown, where he met jack Castle. Jack decided to take the young raven boy under his wing, even making him his deputy. Thanks to Jack, Marty has become more confident, but he is still rather cowardly and shy, and likely to fly away in the event of a confrontation.

Our main setting:
Junktown
Junktown started out as a small trading post where travelers, merchants and nomads could exchange scavenged goods for water or food. More and more people elected to stay in Junktown, and it quickly grew into a small city, with around 400 inhabitants. Tall walls made out of scrap and old cars and trucks protect the city from raiders, but the only two lawmen, Jack Castle and Marty Winger struggle to keep the peace inside the walls.
1551.title: The saga of Jack Castle and Marty Winger

info.brief_description: What will happen in an apocalypse caused by the unforeseen events of DNA manipulation?
info.description:
This story is set in a world where man has tried to take the best 'attributes' such as speed, strength, and even flight, from animals and genetically fuse it with humans via DNA manipulation. The experiments were harsh, only 3 of every 7 or so made it through alive, and even less lived longer than a few days after. The experiments were done on unborn children, since if they were too old, the immune systems would fight off the DNA of the creature used in such a way as to actually leave visible damage, and none that were infused after they were born were able to survive.

Rules:
Only 8, so listen up.
1) At least 4-5 sentences unless it's a choice chapter, and not too many of those (a choice chapter is only to follow a chapter with too many choices for one page, no stopping a story and making one just because you can.), and make it readable, please?
2) This isn't for kids, but it's not strictly for adults either, there can be violence, and death, and even a little blood, but nothing too extreme.
3) At the start, you must describe the main character(s) of your story, if you only have one main, he/she can't die, or else the story is over, no "continue as..." option, but if you have more than one, you can switch to the one still alive, however, there is no introducing a new main mid-story, you can introduce secondary/side-characters, but they are not usable for switching if your main/s die.
4) Side characters can be left out of the 'background' explanations, but are to be talked about at least a bit eventually.(people can gain powers, if there's a logical reason. Ha! logic, in a work of fantasy, that's a novel idea xP)
5) You can have characters that have powers, but nothing so over the top that it's impossible for them to lose in every fight. example: " 'generic name' has the ability to insta-kill simply by wanting too."
6) All skills have to be something that's gained from an animal, even if that power is from a myth/legend, like the kitsune of Japan, or fox spirits, a person infused with a fox can have multiple tails and gain supernatural powers from said tails.
7) Leave an 'Other' option on all chapters so others can add as they like.
8) On the character introduction pages, you can only choose from the main characters on who you want to be.

And that's it, enjoy the world that we all create together.

P.S. I will check on the grammar every now and then, if it's really bad, I'll re-write/delete depending on how bad it is, like if I can't read it at all, I'll likely delete it, but if I can understand what's going on, even if only barely, I'll attempt to make it readable for others.(I won't change the plot or anything, promise)
